intro: Allardia tomentosa, commonly known as the wooly allardia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. Its leaves are broad, ovate, and covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs, giving it a woolly appearance. Allardia tomentosa is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
